newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian PM seeks black activist deported.
newsitem.headline: Australian PM seeks black activist deported.

text.p: Australian Prime Minister John Howard on Monday said a U.S. black human rights activist once convicted of hijacking an aircraft should not have been allowed to enter Australia and should be deported.
Howard said he was "horrified" to hear former Black Panther Lorenzo Ervin had been in Australia since July 4.

"It is quite wrong that somebody like that should have got into the country in the first place," Howard said in a radio interview. "I think somebody with that sort of background ought not to remain in Australia and I hope he doesn't."

Ervin, who was invited to Australia for a four-week speaking tour by anarchist group Angry People, was convicted in the United States in 1969 of hijacking a plane to Cuba. He was given two life sentences, but released from jail in 1983.
Howard said Ervin had apparently misrepresented his past when he applied for a visa to visit Australia and had used a different surname.
